metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4883 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in libXpm. When processing files with .Z or .gz extensions, the library calls external programs to compress and uncompress files, relying on the PATH environment variable to find these programs, which could allow a malicious user to execute other programs by manipulating the PATH environment variable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4883` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxpm4 - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
xpmutils - 1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> motif contains a vendored copy of libxpm under lib/Xm/ with files prefixed by Xpm eg. the file src/parse.c in libxpm is lib/Xm/Xpmparse.c

criterions.comment: libxpm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:3.5.12-1ubuntu0.20.04.1').
motif package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
